Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: This is a very detailed article about mostly XMR webmining, but has others, downloaded from arXiv

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it identifies long-running webmining botnets and how much XMR they mined. they estimate botnets have mined at least 4% of XMR supply

Content: given that those cpu's are mining against GPUs/ASICs/FPGAs, that is quite a lot to mine with CPUs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```
$ ack "hidden" src/rpc
src/rpc/blockchain.cpp
1357:    // hidden. This is used when network upgrade implementations are merged
1729:    { "hidden",             "invalidateblock",        &invalidateblock,        true  },
1730:    { "hidden",             "reconsiderblock",        &reconsiderblock,        true  },

src/rpc/misc.cpp
1399:    { "hidden",             "setmocktime",            &setmocktime,            true  },

src/rpc/server.cpp
200:        if ((strCommand != "" || pcmd->category == "hidden") && strMethod != strCommand)
518:    { "hidden",             "setmocktime",            &setmocktime,            true  },
```

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
the more compilers that exist is the swampier scripts get trying to account for them all
when I was still running "jessie" I had to manually edit make files for 2/3rds of projects because of stuff like that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i maintain CPAN modules which have C extensions in XS ... and yeah, sometimes I get error reports for VAX or netBSD compilers and crazy stuff. Supporting all compilers is a death of a thousand cuts
